Detailed Description

The root of all classes.

This class contains the overloaded new and delete operators that use the builtin garbage collection. (Almost) all classes in LibSylph inherit from this class. If you want your class to communicate with certain LibSylph features, or just if you want to let LibSylph's garbage collector manage dynamic allocation of your class, you should derive from Object.

Note that arrays of Objects are not garbage collected. Instead, use Sylph::Array if you want a garbage collected, safe Array.

Member Function Documentation
